14:25:09.903 [debug] QUERY OK db=10.4ms queue=0.4ms

        SELECT 
          tc.constraint_name,
          tc.table_name,
          kcu.column_name,
          ccu.table_name AS foreign_table_name
        FROM information_schema.table_constraints AS tc 
        JOIN information_schema.key_column_usage AS kcu
          ON tc.constraint_name = kcu.constraint_name
        JOIN information_schema.constraint_column_usage AS ccu
          ON ccu.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name
        WHERE tc.constraint_type = 'FOREIGN KEY' 
          AND tc.table_name IN ('forge_accounts', 'repositories', 'scan_executions', 
                                'validation_executions', 'mitigation_executions')
       []

.14:25:22.007 [info] Cleaning up 0 expired sessions
SQL Injection Pattern: %Rsolv.Security.Pattern{
  id: "python-sql-injection-concat",
  name: "SQL Injection via String Concatenation",
  description: "Using string concatenation (+) in SQL queries can lead to SQL injection",
  type: :sql_injection,
  severity: :high,
  languages: ["python"],
  frameworks: nil,
  regex: ~r/\n        # Direct execute with string concatenation\n        \.execute\s*\([^)]*["'].*\+|\n        # String concatenation used in execute call\n        ["'].*\+.*["'].*\.execute|\n        # SQL variable assignment with concatenation  \n        (query|sql|cmd|statement)\s*=\s*.*["'].*\+|\n        # SQL concatenation in parentheses\n        \(["'].*\+.*["']\)\n      /ix,
  cwe_id: "CWE-89",
  owasp_category: "A03:2021",
  recommendation: "Use parameterized queries: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s', (user_id,))",
  test_cases: %{
    safe: ["cursor.execute(\"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s\", (user_id,))",
     "db.execute(\"DELETE FROM posts WHERE author = ?\", [username])",
     "message = \"Hello \" + username + \"!\"",
     "url = base_url + \"/api/users/\" + user_id"],

Number of Python patterns loaded: 12
Loaded SQL Injection Pattern: %Rsolv.Security.Pattern{
  id: "python-sql-injection-concat",
  name: "SQL Injection via String Concatenation",
  description: "Using string concatenation (+) in SQL queries can lead to SQL injection",
  type: :sql_injection,
  severity: :high,
  languages: ["python"],
  frameworks: nil,
  regex: ~r/\n        # Direct execute with string concatenation\n        \.execute\s*\([^)]*["'].*\+|\n        # String concatenation used in execute call\n        ["'].*\+.*["'].*\.execute|\n        # SQL variable assignment with concatenation  \n        (query|sql|cmd|statement)\s*=\s*.*["'].*\+|\n        # SQL concatenation in parentheses\n        \(["'].*\+.*["']\)\n      /ix,
  cwe_id: "CWE-89",
  owasp_category: "A03:2021",
  recommendation: "Use parameterized queries: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s', (user_id,))",
  test_cases: %{
    safe: ["cursor.execute(\"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s\", (user_id,))",
     "db.execute(\"DELETE FROM posts WHERE author = ?\", [username])",
     "message = \"Hello \" + username + \"!\"",
     "url = base_url + \"/api/users/\" + user_id"],
    vulnerable: ["cursor.execute(\"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = \" + user_id)",
     "db.execute(\"DELETE FROM posts WHERE author = '\" + username + \"'\")",
     "conn.execute(\"UPDATE users SET status = '\" + status + \"' WHERE id = \" + str(id))",
     "query = \"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = \" + user_id; cursor.execute(query)"]
  },
  file_targeting: nil
}

Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Here are some advanced features and techniques:\n\n1. Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Batch Processing:\n   Tag multiple issues with \"rsolv:automate\" and RSOLV creates separate PRs for each.\n\n4. Customizing RSOLV Behavior:\n   Add these tags to your issues:\n   - [performance] - Optimize for speed\n   - [security] - Extra security focus\n   - [minimal] - Smallest possible change\n   - [refactor] - Clean up while fixing\n\nComing Soon:\n- Support for more languages (Go, Rust, PHP)\n- Custom fix preferences per repository\n- Team collaboration features\n- Integration with more platforms\n\nHave a feature request? Just reply to this email!\n\nView advanced documentation: https://rsolv.dev/docs/advanced\n\nBest regards,\nThe RSOLV Team\n\n---\nTo unsubscribe, visit: https://rsolv.dev/unsubscribe?email=utm@example.com\n", headers: %{"X-Postmark-Tag" => "feature-deep-dive"}, attachments: [], assigns: %{}, private: %{tag: "feature-deep-dive"}, blocked: false}
